channel.title: When joining a website/forum
channel.description:
Hi guys. Just for the sake of curiosity, what makes you want to join a forum or discussion community? By this I mean, what general focus makes you join, such as music, entertainment, sports, gaming, etc.
Personally, I'd join a community that had a focus on music or general discussion (news, for example).

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:1, topic:534433”]Hi guys.
Just for the sake of curiosity, what makes you want to join a forum or discussion community? By this I mean, what general focus makes you join, such as music, entertainment, sports, gaming, etc.

Personally, I’d join a community that had a focus on music or general discussion (news, for example).[/quote]

I personally like communities revolved around a specific game, which is why I love active RSPS forums. PRS06 had a pretty decent community, but it had a lack of direction and overall the staff never really seemed to engage with the players.

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

I really like to join communities that have something I am interested in. I joined a chatter bot community a few weeks ago because I was wanting to learn more. I would think anyone would want to join a forum that related to the subject they where most interested in.

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @PhoenixRS PhoenixRS
item.description:
@PhoenixRS wrote:

Join for the community more than anything, intelligence is good. Moderators and staff that aren’t corrupt. But generally if I need something I will sign up and contribute if possible.

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

hot ex staff members like silab

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @hydreigon hydreigon_
item.description:
@hydreigon wrote:

i actually enjoy communities that are made up of intelligent individuals who i can receive advice from when i seek it. size plays a very small part in what makes a community good

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I only register to forums which really have my interest and with an active community,
preferably with an enough mature user base to not have a kinder garden.
Somewhere I can see myself stay for a long time.
Which were only a few in the past years.

[size=5pt]I expect some cookies now from mitb.[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Whatever the topic I enjoy discussing about you will by instinct want to hang with others of that similar nature. If this is in reference to that forum you attempted to start. Please keep into consideration that there was little to no paid advertisement so you can’t expect a whole lot…

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:6, topic:534433”]I enjoy communities which are active, open to new members, and hold a degree of intelligence.

The size of the community doesn’t necessarily matter.[/quote]In most cases, small communities are better; when active.

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I enjoy communities which are active, open to new members, and hold a degree of intelligence.

The size of the community doesn’t necessarily matter.

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

When I wanted to get into rs cheating, I joined an rs cheating forum. When I needed help with my 3d printer, I joined a 3d printer forum. For any site which is useful to me, I will at least check out their forums

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Either nostalgia (the community is centred around something I used to do, play or like) or for learning (the community offers guidance, tutorials or resources).

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I don’t join new discussion communities

Read full topic

item.title: When joining a website/forum
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Suppose it boils down to at least decent amount of activity and it being an overall board discussion such as music, gaming etc.

Read full topic

Hi guys.
